stories.title: Apache BookKeeper Insights Part 1 – External Consensus and Dynamic Membership

stories.text: I’ve been recently approached by a small, innovative, industrial AI startup still in search of their best pipeline, in relation to TensorFlow vs PyTorch… or, better, Keras vs Lightning. There are a number of tutorials and blog articles explaining the differences, but we are here talking about the best bet for the next 1-3 years. This seems a good question for HNers then: what do you think about? For what I see, Lightning is really poised to become for PyTorch what Keras is for TensorFlow, that allowing that small, industrial AI startup to focus in full on their domain cases while using both high-level wrappers and both the underlying libraries. Exciting times ahead? Thanks.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Lightning the PyTorch equivalent of Keras for TensorFlow?
Not Saying It Was Aliens, but ‘Oumuamua Probably Wasn’t a Nitrogen Iceberg

stories.text:
Replying to the requirements: Idea: The DELPHEXION SYSTEMS is the brainchild of Mr Añummadu Obinna. This is a research and a holistic experiment aimed at developing a security system that is decentralized and sophisticated by leveraging real time monitoring and end-to-end encryption. This means that soon, data from people, corporation and government will not be seen in the wrong hands.

Problems: No doubt, we all know that phishing attacks, hacking and other kinds of cyber attack have really plagued so many people, government and institution at Large. This is as a result of centralization and the possibility of having malicious insiders who could betray interests just for some personal gains. We have come to gradually study how some security breaches occur and we noticed that weak security infrastructure, malicious insiders and other hackers seek vulnerability and use this opportunity to do the wrong thing. We are therefore developing and researching an idea that is going to bypass all these vulnerability
stories.title: Delphexion Systems

stories.text:
Hello I found the exact name of the file im interested in on predb, and on other databases. I found the DDL on "scnlog": -The "WEB0DAY_INT" (nuked, stolen from WEB, habit) Virustotal from 49 flags. -The "TSZ" Virustotal from 36 flags. Malwarebytes on PC also give me trojans for both. The ".nfo" files are identical to the release of the scene, for number/name/size of rar matches.

I trust the scene, I don't think 2 groups, have placed malware. How can i verify that the versions I own have not been tampered with? Is there a way to know if i have the same version of the release a compare between the checksums? How files would help me; .srr .diz .svf? How do i versify, do i need to do it before merging rar?

Thank you all.

P.S Link to the Virustoal checkup https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/02a042cd7c47924fa0c5e4c2b5a990a6304ff4e81739a192d397dbc845df9861/detection

https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/9bef8d8fb05c7a9aa11a73d8d480cb0f09ed02ec386b173dc7b34c998837a5c9

this is clean https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/6af0af4b97af0eee1316fdb14742844ef962d488f732bd70ef4767098aef90fc/detection
